title: Altria and Philip Morris M&A Talks Dissolve, but Wells Fargo Sees Silver Lining
text:
Sometimes it’s best to just stay good friends. That’s Well Fargo’s take on the dissolution of merger talks between Altria Group and Philip Morris International, as the firm thinks that both stocks are still worth buying.

The back story. Altria (ticker: MO) and Philip Morris (PM) were once one company until the two split about a decade ago, with the former focusing on the domestic market and the latter handling international sales. That relationship led to speculation that they’d rejoin, and late last month, the two companies...
description: Many shareholders opposed the Altria–Philip Morris merger, and with uncertainties behind them, both companies look appealing to Wells Fargo analyst Bonnie Herzog
